title: Attempting to reconnect - finally resolved
body:
Okay guys so I've been the victim to the 'attempting to reconnect' bug which was happening on LoL. 

The issue I was getting was a constant 'attempting to reconnect' loop or at least a dropped connection twice per game. There are so many threads about this and there is still a lot of people who have still not resolved this. In short, it's not your firewall or DNS causing the issue.

I'm on 100/40mbs NBN, firstly with OzLinked (now in liquidation) and then ANT Communications (don't bother) when I had these issues. It turns out these resellers were not providing true speeds and were often bottle necked by the wholesaler. Whilst I had no lag in game there was packet loss.

As much as 1% packet loss will cause the game to drop out and you'll constantly battle this issue until you resolve it with your ISP. I moved my ISP to TPG 100/40 (a backbone provider) and now I have 0% packet loss and a flawless LoL experience. 

A great way to the validate your issue is to test your bandwidth here - 
http://sourceforge.net/projects/winmtr/ and download WinMTR 

Run tests on 
103.240.227.5 and then 103.240.227.25 

Another tool to use is ping test - 
http://www.pingtest.net/

If you are getting packet loss then your only solution is to look at speaking to your provider or swapping altogether. If you are going through NBN please ONLY buy through a backbone provider.

Big shoutout to the LoL Support crew who did a great job helping me circle the issue. 

Hope that at least helps some of you out there!
